description: This course is an introduction to speaking, reading, and writing Japanese; writing includes the learning of all syllabic letters (Hiragana and Katakana) and basic Kanji (Chinese characters). Class meets four times weekly. Individual language laboratory visits are also required. Offered annually in the spring semester. Prerequisite: JAPAN 111 or equivalent.
name: Beginning Japanese II
notes: Students in Japanese 112A must also register for one lab Japanese 112 AL, BL, or CL.

revisions.notes: Students in Japanese 112A and B must also register for one lab Japanese 112 AL or BL.
Students in Japanese 112A must also register for one lab Japanese 112 AL or BL.
